title: Lit Rates in China and Russia

content.question: Which of the following best explains why China and Russia are among the nations with the highest literacy rates in the world?

choices.label: The Communist Parties in both countries require all members to have secondary degrees.
The governments of both countries implemented literacy policies to maintain political legitimacy.
Countries with command economies often have higher literacy rates than countries with market economies.
Since 2000, the Russian and Chinese governments have promoted literacy policies to slow emigration.

content.answer: The governments of both countries implemented literacy policies to maintain political legitimacy.

unit.text: 5: Political and Economic Changes and Development

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain the implications of the similarities and differences between countries with similar political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
